verses.text: 不忠的後果「你們要對你們的兄弟說：『我的子民』；要對你們的姊妹說：『蒙憐憫的』。

words.note: Often used in biblical context for 'God's people'.
Often indicates passive voice, 'to be granted'.

verses.text: 要與你們的母親爭論，你們要爭論，因為她不是我的妻子，我也不是她的丈夫；好讓她除掉臉上的淫相，和乳間的淫態，

words.note: Refers to visible appearance or expression of promiscuity.
Specifically refers to the chest/breast area in this context.
Refers to gestures or demeanor of promiscuity.

verses.text: 免得我把她剝光，赤身露體，使她像剛生下來的那天一樣；又使她像曠野，像無水的旱地一般，叫她因乾渴而死。

words.note: A formal, descriptive term for nakedness, frequently used in the Bible.
Commonly used in biblical contexts to refer to desert regions.

verses.text: 我必不憐恤她的兒子，因為他們是像娼妓的兒女；

words.note: A formal term for prostitute, common in older texts and biblical contexts.

verses.text: 因為他們的母親賣了淫，懷他們的作了羞恥的事；因為她曾說：『我要跟隨我那些愛人。我的餅和水，羊毛和麻布，油和我所喝的，都是他們給的。』

words.note: A specific idiom meaning to engage in prostitution or sexual immorality.
In this context, implies paramours or illicit lovers rather than spouse.
Indicates that what follows is the object of a verb or a passive action.

verses.text: 因此，我要用荊棘堵塞她的通道，我要築牆圍住她，使她找不著出路。

words.note: Often found in biblical texts.
著 (zháo) as a resultative complement means 'to succeed in'.

verses.text: 她要追趕她那些愛人，卻追不上；要尋找他們，卻找不著。她就說：『我要回去，回到前夫那裡，因為從前比現在好得多了。』

words.note: In this biblical context, refers to unfaithful 'lovers' or 'idols'.
上 (shàng) as a resultative complement means 'to succeed in catching/reaching'.
著 (zháo) as a resultative complement means 'to succeed in'.

verses.text: 其實她不知道，是我把五穀、新酒、橄欖油賜給了她；甚至他們用來製造巴力的金銀，也是我大量給她的；

words.note: Indicates the following noun is the direct object of the verb.
Refers to the five major grains in ancient China, here generally 'all grains'.
A common biblical term for fresh, unfermented or recently fermented wine.
A staple and significant commodity in biblical lands.
Formal verb, often used for divine or superior giving.
Implies 'used to come to (do something)'.
A Canaanite deity often mentioned in the Old Testament.
Forms a 'shi...de' structure emphasizing the giver.

verses.text: 因此，到了收割的時候，到了出酒的季節，我必收回五穀和新酒；用來給她遮蔽裸體的羊毛和麻布，我也必奪回。

words.note: Refers to the season of making or drawing out wine.
Expresses strong certainty or necessity.
Refers to the five major grains in ancient China, here generally 'all grains'.
A common biblical term for fresh, unfermented or recently fermented wine.
Implies 'used to come to (do something)'.
More formal or literary than common '蓋'.
Often found in biblical texts with connotations of shame or vulnerability.
Often signifies mourning or coarse clothing in biblical contexts.
Expresses strong certainty or necessity.

verses.text: 那時，我要在她那些愛人眼前，暴露她的下體；也沒有人能救她脫離我的手。

words.note: In this biblical context, refers to unfaithful 'lovers' or 'idols'.
Euphemistic term for genitals; often carries connotations of shame in biblical texts.
Figuratively refers to divine power or control.

verses.text: 我必使她的一切歡樂、節期、新月、安息日，或任何盛會都終止。

words.note: Refers to religious feast days.
Refers to the new moon festival/observance.
Refers to solemn assemblies or festivals.

verses.text: 我必毀壞她的葡萄樹和無花果樹，就是她曾說：『這是我作妓女所賺的，是我那些愛人給我的。』我必使這些果樹成為荒林，任由田野的走獸吃掉。

words.note: Lit. 'flowerless fruit tree', as figs grow inside.
Contextually refers to 'paramours' or 'false gods'.

verses.text: 她在拜眾巴力的日子，向他們燒香，佩戴耳環首飾，打扮自己，跟隨她那些愛人，卻把我遺忘，所以我必懲罰她。」這是耶和華說的。

words.note: Refers to various pagan deities known as Baals.
Contextually refers to 'paramours' or 'false gods'.

verses.text: 再蒙眷愛「因此，我要誘導她，領她到曠野，對她說安慰的話。
在那裡我要把葡萄園歸還給她，使亞割谷變成『希望之門』。她必在那裡回應，像她少年的時候一樣，也像她從埃及地上來的那天一般。」
耶和華說：「到那日，你必稱呼我『伊施』（「伊施」意即「我夫」），不再稱呼我『巴力』（「巴力」意即「我主」）。

words.note: Hebrew for 'my husband'
A Canaanite deity, meaning 'master' or 'lord'.

verses.text: 我要把『巴力』的名字從她口中除掉；他們的名字沒有人再提起。
到那日，為了他們，我必和田野的走獸、空中的飛鳥、地上的爬行的動物立約；我必從這地折斷弓弩、刀劍和兵器（「兵器」原文作「戰爭」）；使他們安然居住。

words.note: Commonly used in religious contexts for making a pact with God.

verses.text: 我必聘你永遠歸我，以公義、正直、忠信和憐憫聘你歸我。

words.note: Often means 'to engage for marriage' in this context.

verses.text: 我必以信實聘你歸我；這樣，你就必認識耶和華。」
耶和華說：「到那日，我必應允，我必應允天，天必應允地，

words.note: Often implies granting a request or answering a prayer.

verses.text: 地必應允五穀、新酒和油。這些必應允耶斯列（「耶斯列」意即「栽種」）。

words.note: Refers to the five major grains, representing all crops.
Verb-object compound, 'to plant/sow seeds'.

verses.text: 我必為了自己把她栽種在這地。我必憐恤羅．路哈瑪（「羅．路哈瑪」意即「不蒙憐恤」）。我必對羅．阿米（「羅．阿米」意即「非我民」）說：『你是我的子民』，他必說：『你是我的 神。』」

words.note: Introduces object of action, indicating disposal or handling.
Verb-object compound, 'to show mercy/pity'.
Often used in passive constructions like '蒙恩' (receive grace).
Here used as a noun, 'un-received mercy'.
Refers to a nation's people or God's chosen people.
Honorific space commonly used before '神' in Chinese Bibles.
